utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Science project?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No, it’s a pet. Say hello to Theodore, Dad. I’m rat-sitting him for Ashley.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello, Theodore. How goes the rat race?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Did you know the average lifespan of a rat is two to three years? Ashley has had Theodore for five. And this is the first time he’s left him with anyone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Trusting you with a treasured pet. That’s a big step in a relationship.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah. I guess it kind of is.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: I must say, the little plague pusher is not very diligent about his exercise. I don’t know why. I think it’s just those beady little eyes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s a rat, Mother. They all have beady eyes. That’s where the phrase comes from.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, those are for Theodore. He has a very specific diet I’m supposed to follow.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, unless he’s Ben I’m sure he won’t hold it against me. If anyone needs me, I’ll be in the park with a dead body.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Who’s Ben?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Killer rat movie. Before your time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, I understand ferrets as a pet. Snakes, spiders, even a hairless mole, but a rat?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Probably kids in the city who keep cockroaches as pets.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, you’re probably right. What’s the strangest pet you’ve ever had?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You. Hey Lanie.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s this, a hit and run?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: In a manner of speaking. Two BMX bikers rode over the body, then called it in. But the cause of death are the gunshot wounds. One to the chest and two more in the back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he’s wounded on both sides?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe there were two shooters? And he was caught in the crossfire?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Won’t know ‘til I get him back to the lab.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Got an ID?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Leonard Levitt, Ozark Park, Queens. Wallet, cash, keys … everything’s still here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means it wasn’t theft.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Something much more nefarious. A feather. Alternating stripes, uniform color … This is no ordinary pigeon feather. This is from a bird of prey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what are you suggesting, Castle? That a bird shot him three times?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not just any bird. This is the calling card of a murderer known only as The Falcon Killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or, maybe before getting shot he just bent down and picked up the feather.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: See, that’s why you’ll never be a bestselling novelist. No sense of drama.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I find that dead bodies are usually enough. . Thanks, Lanie.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, so we ran background on your vic. It’s pretty thin. He was a New York City Transit employee, worked in the subway out of 116th Street station.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He worked uptown and he lived in Queens? Then what was he doing in the park? That’s pretty out of the way.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, we thought that he was looking to buy some weed or some love, but he has no drug history, no convictions of solicitations, no nothing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about his family?

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Both parents are deceased, guy never married, has no children. It’s like he barely existed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Making him the perfect victim. Mild mannered city employee, lured into a conveniently wooded area, struck down by a murderer with the speed and cunning of a bird of prey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t ask. You guys go to his apartment. Find out who he is and what he was doing in the park.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Lividity and temperature puts time of death between five and seven PM. The victim also has a broken wrist; could be post mortem from those BMXers playing X Games on his corpse.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about the gunshot wounds?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: All three entry wounds were made by the same weapon, a .45. There was only one shooter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the same person shot him in the front and then shot him in the back?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Didn’t make any sense to me, either, so I decided to take some measurements. Turns out, the wounds are of different depths.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: The wound on his chest is very shallow, indicating the shot came from a distance.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How far?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: About a hundred and fifty feet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s quite an accurate shot with a handgun.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yeah, I’d say your shooter had some shooting experience. But the next two shots, in the back, were close range. Inside six feet, maybe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he got shot in the chest at long range, turned around to run –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But he’s wounded. The killer goes after him to finish what he’s started with a double tap to the back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He wasn’t just shot. He was hunted down and killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But why?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What was this guy up to?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No idea.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What abut that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Looks like some sort of counter.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What do you think he was counting?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nothing good. Night vision, spotting scope, parabolic microphone. Top quality, too. What’s a subway worker doing with all this?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t know. Whatever he was up to, it had something to do with the park. Look. This is right where his body was found.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Five twenty-six. That’s right around our time of death.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Looks like he was tracing something, or someone, with the initials BHS.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And it looks like that someone found him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Surveillance equipment, clandestine meetings, a professional hit? Mix in the subway and we’re looking at The Taking of Pellham 123, or better yet, Money Train. And one of these people could be a secret accomplice. That’s what I love about the subway. Down here everyone’s got a story.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: See, that’s the difference between you and me, Castle. You see the subway as a place to pick up dialogue for your novels.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or the occasional investment banker on her way to the gym.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I, on the other hand, see it as a way of getting from point A to point B.

utterance.speaker: MARIO
utterance.content: Lightbulb Len’s dead, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lightbulb Len?

utterance.speaker: MARIO
utterance.content: Yeah, it was his job to change the light bulbs in the stations and tunnels all over New York. I figured something was wrong. It’s the first time he’s missed work in twenty two years.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Rivera, Len was found shot to death in the park. Any idea what he was doing there?

utterance.speaker: MARIO
utterance.content: The guy changed light bulbs for a living, You know, a job like that, it’s not for the social. I mean, for the twelve years I was his supervisor, I don’t think we ever had one personal conversation.

utterance.speaker: MARIO
utterance.content: But you know who you should talk to?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Sansone! Arthur!

utterance.speaker: ARTHUR
utterance.content: I’m sorry. It’s just … why would anybody want to shoot him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well we were hoping that you could tell us that.

utterance.speaker: ARTHUR
utterance.content: The guy was one of the unsung heroes of this city. He saved a lot of lives.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry. I thought … I thought he changed light bulbs.

utterance.speaker: ARTHUR
utterance.content: Bad things happen in darkness, Mr. Castle. Dimly lit tunnels, darkened stairwells … if Len heard about a blown bulb before shift end he would stay late on his own time to fix it. And of course there was his response to the Abe Lipschitz tragedy. 1989? An electrocution of a bulb changer at the Brighton Beach station?

utterance.speaker: ARTHUR
utterance.content: This is a circuit interrupter switch. Shuts down all the power inside a tunnel so that electrical maintenance could be performed safely. Down here it’s called the Lenny Box, because it took a visionary like Len Levitt to design it and force the transit authority to install one in every station in this city.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about high tech gear? Did Lenny ever use any night vision or microphones for his work?

utterance.speaker: ARTHUR
utterance.content: No, why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How about the initials BHS? Does that mean anything to you? Maybe someone or something that Len was keeping tabs on?

utterance.speaker: ARTHUR
utterance.content: The only thing that Len Levitt ever kept tabs on was every single bulb he ever changed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he have any enemies that you know of?

utterance.speaker: ARTHUR
utterance.content: You don’t make waves without making a few enemies. Because of Len we’re in the middle of a system wide changeover from incandescent to compact fluorescents. New technology comes in, the city ends up with a warehouse of old bulbs. That makes some guy in a suit at the old bulb factory very unhappy. You ask me? Corporations conspired to take Lenny out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Lenny Box. So the guy’s an inventor.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Apparently he was an underground renaissance man.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Guess that explains all the electronics.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, and the counter in his apartment. All the light bulbs he changed.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Seriously, this guy changed over a million light bulbs?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The man was an unsung hero, all right? Cut down by the forces of Big Bulb.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Big Bulb?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The filament industrial complex.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lenny’s buddy is delusional if he actually thinks that Lenny was killed by a light bulb conspiracy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah … I wouldn’t dismiss our subterranean friend just yet. I was running through Len’s phone records and one jumped out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The outgoing call to the New York City employee tip line?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s where you call to rat out your coworkers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Must rat always be used in the pejorative? In the Chinese zodiac, the rat is the –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was the tip?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, all those incandescent bulb they were replacing? Levitt claims that he has evidence that his supervisor was stealing them and then reselling them on the black market.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You mean Mario Rivera?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The same. The charges pan out, the guy could lose his job and his pension. Oh and get this, before he was in the Transit Authority, Mario was in the Marine Corps where he won a weapons medal for sharpshooting.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you last night between five and seven PM?

utterance.speaker: MARIO
utterance.content: Working.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We checked. You clocked out at four thirty-four.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You hopped the B or the D, down to 59th Street in the express lane, that takes, what? Ten minutes? Plenty of time to get to the park, kill Len.

utterance.speaker: MARIO
utterance.content: Why would I kill Len?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because he filed a report against you with the Transit Authority when he found out about Costa Rica.

utterance.speaker: MARIO
utterance.content: What the hell are you guys talking about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: These are emails that were sent from you to your contact in Costa Rica.

utterance.speaker: MARIO
utterance.content: These are my private emails.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sent from a workplace computer, which means we can look.

utterance.speaker: MARIO
utterance.content: So? I was thinking about taking a vacation down there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Drink a few cervezas, maybe going parasailing on the beach, sell some light bulbs to some locals.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The city has a warehouse full of old incandescent light bulbs that you figured no one would miss, so you sold them to a wholesaler in Costa Rica for twenty cents a pop. That’s a hundred grand.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only someone did miss them. Someone with the word ‘lightbulb’ in his name. When you found out Len was on to you, you realized you could lose your job and your pension. You couldn’t afford to let him go to the transit authority with what he knew.

utterance.speaker: MARIO
utterance.content: I didn’t kill nobody.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then, why don’t you just come clean with what you did last night between five and seven? The thing about murderers, Mario, is that they tend to not have solid alibis.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Generally because they’re murdering somebody.

utterance.speaker: MARIO
utterance.content: Look. Those old light bulbs were just going to get destroyed and end up in a landfill. I was doing the city a favor. So I make a little extra. Who gets hurt?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … I’m going to go with Len.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Last chance, Mario.

utterance.speaker: MARIO
utterance.content: After work I went up to the Grand concourse to pack up a shipment of light bulbs. They went out to Costa Rica last night. You can check, I was there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Thanks. He’s telling the truth. Len’s call to the tip line? Turns out the transit cops had him under surveillance all last week. His tail has him in the Bronx last night, just like he said.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Call the transit cops and tell them that we just closed their case for them.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So if light bulbs didn’t get Lenny killed, then what did?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, it can’t be a coincidence that he was killed right there at about the same time that he has written down.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what does BHS stand for?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bronx High School.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Big honkin’ stereo.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Boys have shoes?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Try Byron H. Singer. Found a small vendor decal on the parabolic microphone that we found in his apartment so I called the vendor to find out if he knew why Len bought the equipment. Turns out, Len didn’t buy it at all. It was purchased two months ago by an insurance actuary named Byron H. Singer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: BHS! Sorry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Singer, thank you for coming down.

utterance.speaker: BYRON
utterance.content: They said it was important.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know a man named Len Levitt?

utterance.speaker: BYRON
utterance.content: What did that bastard tell you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He didn’t tell us anything.

utterance.speaker: BYRON
utterance.content: Good! Because he’s a liar. He thought that he knew better than me. He thought he knew better than everybody.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Singer –

utterance.speaker: BYRON
utterance.content: I don’t care if he didn’t believe me. I don’t care how much it hurt him. I know what I saw.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what did you see?

utterance.speaker: BYRON
utterance.content: The two of them. Together. In the park. Like a pair of lovebirds. But he accused me of making the whole thing up. I mean, why would I make something like that up? Why would anybody?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Singer, what exactly did you see in the park?

utterance.speaker: BRYON
utterance.content: I saw enough. And believe me, I was pretty shocked to see them together. I knew I had to tell Len before somebody else did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Len must have been very angry when you told him.

utterance.speaker: BRYON
utterance.content: Very angry and jealous. But I had followed them and found their secret spot. And I told him when and where to find them. I even lent him some of my equipment so he could spy on them himself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So then he goes to the park and he sees for himself.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then he confronts them in a jealous rage and they kill him.

utterance.speaker: BYRON
utterance.content: They do what now?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They kill him. The cheating girlfriend and the lover.

utterance.speaker: BYRON
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT_CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, who did you see in the park that night?

utterance.speaker: BYRON
utterance.content: The red tailed hawks.

utterance.speaker: BYRON
utterance.content: There haven’t been a nesting pair in the park for forty years.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You … mean this is about birds?

utterance.speaker: BYRON
utterance.content: Not just birds. The red tailed hawks! Len oversees the log in the Central Park Boathouse where all the sightings are officially recorded. He refused to acknowledge my sighting. So I told him if he didn’t believe me he should go out to the park and see for himself. They nest at dusk.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Singer, were you in the park yesterday between five and seven PM?

utterance.speaker: BYRON
utterance.content: Usually I am, but yesterday I was in my office working.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And can any of your colleagues verify that?

utterance.speaker: BYRON
utterance.content: I’m sure they can. But about the hawks, and I want this on the official record, I would never exaggerate or fabricate a bird sighting. It’s unthinkable!

utterance.speaker: BYRON
utterance.content: They’re there. And I saw them first.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m putting that in the official record.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the equipment, the park, the feather, and BHS. Looks like we’ve explained everything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, except why he was killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good morning, Mother.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Morning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So why is Gram on the table and why are you on the floor?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, he’s gone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Theodore?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: When I fed him his quinoa salad with wheat berries I must not have closed the cage door all the way and now he’s gone and Ashley’s going to hate me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, he’s not going to hate you. He’ll understand.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No, he won’t! He trusted me and I let him down.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, not yet you haven’t. We’ll find him. Have you looked in your room?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: And in Gram’s, too.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: If that creature entered my room, I’m going to need a new bed. And wardrobe.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, what if he got out. Like out, out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, Theodore’s an uptown rat. He’s here someplace. Okay, to find a rodent you have to think like a rodent. You are Theodore. What do you want?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Food.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nah, you’ve got a personal chef. You’re not hungry.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Warmth. I’d want to stay warm and safe.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Cozy, quiet place out of the way where no one’s going to step on you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Front hall closet!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nice.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You see him?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No, he’s not here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s not here.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You need to go?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And leave you rat-less?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s my responsibility, Dad, not yours. I’ll find him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. Call me. If you need anything.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Just so you know, I’m checking into the Plaza.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: And you’re paying!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay Castle, I’m here. What was so important?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your first clue is – ‘The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Nighttime’.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh geez Castle, I haven’t even had my coffee yet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: From the Sherlock Holmes story, "Silver Blaze". Holmes unmasks the murderer because of what didn’t happen. The dog didn’t bark. That’s how he knew the dog must have known the killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, yes, I remember the story.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then you know the hardest form of detection is looking for the thing that isn’t there. Byron said that Len was going to verify the hawks. Verify, as in, provide proof, which means …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He would have had a camera.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which we didn’t find. And if he was taking pictures …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We should be able to figure out what he was up to.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We found the body here where he took the last two bullets.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Running away from his killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, a broken wrist.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: From the BMX guys riding over his body.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or he fell from a tree.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This tree. There’s a fresh divot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s all birds.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmm. Red tailed hawks! Looks like Byron Singer was telling the truth after all.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, remind me to notify the bird police.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But I doubt it was the hawks that killed him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Woah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lightbulb Len witnessed a child abduction.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And the last thing he saw was his killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We don’t know his name or age, but we’re estimating between ten and twelve years old. He has brown hair, hazel eyes, and was last seen wearing shorts, sneakers, and a grey and white jacket. Now, our kidnapper is male, brown hair, between five ten and six foot. He was carrying a Glock .45 which matches the size of the slugs we found in our victim’s body. Now both photos have timestamps on them, so we know that the abduction took place at five twelve PM on Tuesday.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: After forty eight hours the chances of finding a child abduction victim alive go way down. The only thing that matters is finding that kid.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If he’s been missing for thirty six hours, how come his parents haven’t reported it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They might not know. Or they might be under duress.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was wearing shorts. Which means he probably knew he was going to the park.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, if he wasn’t lured there maybe he knew his kidnapper.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, then why would the kidnapper need a gun?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I emailed the photo to the New York State Police and the parole division. They’re looking into any kidnappers with this abduction MO. And Esposito is canvassing that part of the park looking for any witnesses.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about schools? If the boy goes to a local school they’d know he was absent.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Have uniforms fax his photo to all schools in the five boroughs.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Done.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That car looks to be a compact or a sub-compact. Can we get the make or model?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lab’s already looking into it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’re pulling video from all traffic cameras leading in and out of the park on Tuesday evening. Maybe we’ll catch a license plate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or the driver’s face.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if we were to enlarge this part of the photo. Not the face, just this part of the window.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you thinking of the reflection?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m wondering if maybe we can see the kidnapper’s face in that side view mirror.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s worth a shot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I need a CSU photo tech up here, now.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Are you sure you haven’t seen him?

utterance.speaker: VENDOR
utterance.content: Man, I see so many kids every day I couldn’t tell one from the next.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What about a blue car at the same time, somewhere around this area?

utterance.speaker: VENDOR
utterance.content: Tuesday about five?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: VENDOR
utterance.content: Yeah, as a matter of fact, a blue Saturn.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You sure?

utterance.speaker: VENDOR
utterance.content: Yeah, people I forget. Things that get in my way I remember. It was parked right in front of my regular spot. Instead I’ve got to set up at the edge of the roadway. I almost get clipped by a cab.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Anybody inside?

utterance.speaker: VENDOR
utterance.content: No, because I would have yelled at the driver if there was. I don’t know what’s wrong with people in the city.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: VENDOR
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Our pretzel vendor ID’d the kidnapper’s car as a blue Saturn sedan anywhere from ’07 to ’02. The problem is there are six thousand blue Saturns registered in the tri-state area alone. Ryan, where are we on the traffic cams?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The make and model will help narrow it down, but there’s a lot of footage. There’s also no central database for school absences. We can’t sort by grade or gender and there’s a bad cold making the rounds, so more kids are out than usual.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about state police?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: A whole lot of nada. And nothing popped on parolees with the same kidnapping MO. Yes, I’ll continue to hold.

utterance.speaker: CSU TECH
utterance.content: Detective, enhanced and enlarged.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The enhancement only increased the pixelation on all these. You can’t even see there’s a side view mirror.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s not like on 24, Castle. In the real world zoom and enhance can only get us so far.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah but … you can’t even … there’s no reflection, it’s just mush.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. No. God, this kid isn’t that much younger than Alexis.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t worry. We’ll find him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve seen this before.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’ve seen what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This mark. On his sock. Alexis used to get these when she played soccer. They’re cleat marks from where other kids kicked her in the shin.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If he was playing soccer in the park he might be part of an organized team or a league.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And youth leagues have websites that you can go to that parents and kids can track scores and standings.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I spoke to the league commissioner and only one ten to twelve year old team had practice on Tuesday. The Wildcats.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT_CASTLE
utterance.content: There!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Tyler Donegal. He’s twelve.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan, let’s get everything we can on this kid. The clock is ticking and we’ve got to bring him back alive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tyler Donegal lives with his mother in Westchester. Court records show that the parents' divorce was finalized two months ago.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: You reach the parents?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Just got off with the mother, Mirielle Leftcourt. She moved out of the city last year, got remarried to an anesthesiologist last month. She says she has no idea that her son is missing. He was spending two days in the city with her ex. She’s on her way in now.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: If the father had custody, where the hell is he and why didn’t he report the boy missing?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’re working on that, sir. The father is a maintenance supervisor at a high rise on West Broadway and Canal. He lives six blocks from Central Park.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Donegal called in sick for work yesterday and today.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Divorced parents, one child, one spouse remarries quickly.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So she dumps the janitor in the city for the doctor in the ‘burbs.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: All the father has left his is son. It’s got all the hallmarks of a custodial abduction.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You got a photo?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’ll get one.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Dean Donegal. Five foot ten, one seventy-five, brown hair.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, the vitals match.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but why do you need a gun to kidnap your own son? You just put him in the car, tell him you’re going for ice cream. What’s he doing?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey Beckett? The mother’s here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, Ryan, you go to Dean’s office, Esposito, you check out his apartment. Maybe something else is going on with that family.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: MIRIELLE LEFTCOURT
utterance.content: Where’s my son?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s what we’re trying to determine, Ms. Leftcourt. When was the last time you spoke with him?

utterance.speaker: MIRIELLE
utterance.content: Uh, two days ago when I dropped him off at his father’s.

utterance.speaker: ELLIOT LEFTCOURT
utterance.content: He was supposed to be with Dean. Have you talked with Dean?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re trying to locate him now.

utterance.speaker: MIRIELLE
utterance.content: He’s not at work? He never misses work.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you tell me about the divorce? How did Dean take that?

utterance.speaker: MIRIELLE
utterance.content: Um, not well. He was very bitter and angry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Does he own a gun?

utterance.speaker: MIRIELLE
utterance.content: A handgun. Yes. There were break-ins in his building.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know what kind?

utterance.speaker: MIRIELLE
utterance.content: Why are you asking me about a gun? Was somebody shot? Was my son shot?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, nobody was shot, Ms. Leftcourt. It’s just the man who took your son was carrying a gun. Now, I’m going to have to show you this photograph. Do you recognize this man?

utterance.speaker: MIRIELLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. Is that Dean?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I was hoping that you could tell me. What about this car? Is that his car?

utterance.speaker: ELLIOT
utterance.content: Dean doesn’t own a car. He rents one as he needs one.

utterance.speaker: MIRIELLE
utterance.content: A Glock. Dean’s gun, it’s a Glock. We had to itemize our property for the divorce.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Leftcourt, does Dean have a place that he likes to take Tyler? Any favorite hangouts?

utterance.speaker: ELLIOT
utterance.content: As far as I know, he’s never taken him anywhere.

utterance.speaker: MIRIELLE
utterance.content: That’s not true. Dean’s family has a cabin in the Poconos.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Pennsylvania State Police are on their way to the cabin. With any luck, we’ll find Tyler.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can’t imagine how Tyler’s mother feels.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, me neither.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When Alexis was four, we went Christmas shopping at some mall in White Plains. I was trying on some charcoal fedora. I turn around, she is gone. Vanished. I looked everywhere. So did mall security, so did the police. We searched for an hour. You have to be a novelist to think of all the worst case scenarios.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where did you find her?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Behind a rack of winter coats. She got bored. She crawled underneath there and went to sleep.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To this day I dream about that.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Just got off the phone with Esposito. Looks like Dean’s on the move.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What did they find?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: It’s what they didn’t find. No toothbrush, no deodorant, no shampoo in the shower.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll run his credit card for anything that indicates he’s travelling.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Dean’s desk?

utterance.speaker: TERESA DE LA TORRE
utterance.content: You can’t miss it, right? Pictures everywhere. He calls it Tyler-Palooza.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Is this his only work area?

utterance.speaker: TERESA
utterance.content: Yeah, uh huh.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How did he sound when he called in sick? Did he sound stressed?

utterance.speaker: TERESA
utterance.content: To tell you the truth, Detective, Dean didn’t call in sick. I covered for him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: TERESA
utterance.content: His ex-wife got remarried to some rich doctor like five minutes after the divorce was final. He had legal bills up the ass. I figured he just needed to spend a little time with his son. So what if he didn’t call in sick. I had his back. That’s how we do it down here.

utterance.speaker: COWORKER
utterance.content: Hey, Teresa!

utterance.speaker: TERESA
utterance.content: All right, already!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What’s in Indy, Dean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he’s got family in Indianapolis? Uh, friends? Someone he can trust? Someone who can hide him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but there weren’t any airline tickets purchased in his name or in Tyler’s.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. The cabin’s empty. PA State Troopers say it looks like there hasn’t been anyone there in months.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Just got a hit on Dean Donegal’s financials. An hour ago he booked a motel room in Jamaica, Queens.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s not far from the airport. He might still be trying to get Tyler out of town.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If we’re lucky.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: He shot someone, he’s on the run, he under extreme duress. Let’s get him before this ends bloody for everyone.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hands! Show me your hands!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Tyler! Tyler, are you here?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Tyler!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Bathroom’s clear.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He’s not here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where’s Tyler?

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: I don’t know. They told me to check into a motel and wait for further instructions.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who did?

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: I don’t know! All I know is they took him. If I help you, they’ll kill my son.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where is Tyler, Dean?

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: I told you, I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why were you going to Indianapolis?

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: Indian– what are you taking about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We know you were checking on airfare.

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: I was researching a trip for the holidays. What, you think I took my own son?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were in a hotel by the airport.

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: That’s where they told me to go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: Please… they said if I talked to the cops, he’s dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dean, if your son is in danger then you need to tell us what you know.

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: I went to pick him up after practice. When he wasn’t at the usual spot, I figured he must have walked home. When I got back to my apartment, that phone was on my doormat. It had a text on it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: ‘We have your son. Tell no one. Use only this phone. Contact the police and Tyler dies.’ ‘Stand by, we will tell you where to go and what to do. Tell no one, your son’s life depends on it.’

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What do they want from you?

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: I have no idea.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Dean’s Glock is a 9 millimeter.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Right make, wrong model. Lightbulb Len was killed with a .45.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The SIM card form his cell phone is a burner and the text messages aren’t coming from another phone. They’re coming from an internet texting service based in the Ukraine. No IP address. Untraceable.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Track the SIM. And I want a printout of every text message. And get the electronic serial number off that phone. I want to find out when it was purchased and by whom.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You got it, sir.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What do they want from you? Are they after ransom?

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: You’re kidding. I’m forty grand in debt after my divorce. I’m looking up at broke.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about your ex-wife’s new husband? He has money.

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: They’re not calling him, they’re calling me. What if they find out I’m here? I just want my son back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then your best option is to work with us. Let us help you.

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: I need to get some air.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, I know this is hard. But you have to trust us. We will find him.

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: Okay. Don’t let them hurt my boy.

utterance.speaker: MIRIELLE
utterance.content: Where is he?

utterance.speaker: MIRELLE
utterance.content: Where’s Tyler? You should have been there to pick him up at soccer practice! This is why I should have never agreed to joint custody.

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: We’re doing everything we can. It’s just … it’s going to be all right.

utterance.speaker: ELLIOT
utterance.content: How could you let this happen?

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: Stay out of this, you’re not family.

utterance.speaker: ELLIOT
utterance.content: He’s my boy too.

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: Sit down!

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: That's enough!

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Now I need everyone to calm down. Cooperate and think. Dean, you notice anyone unusual hanging around your son? Anything out of the ordinary going on in his life?

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: No. I mean … I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: What about you two?

utterance.speaker: ELLIOT
utterance.content: Nothing comes to mind.

utterance.speaker: MIRELLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Now this abduction was clearly planned, so the kidnapper had to know where Tyler was going to be.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Sir, this is a message. It’s from the kidnapper. There’s a video attached.

utterance.speaker: TYLER
utterance.content: Hi Dad. I know you’re worried, but I’m okay. They say if you do what they ask, everything will be fine, just don’t go to the police. I’ll see you soon, and don’t forget to feed Ace.

utterance.speaker: MIRIELLE
utterance.content: Oh, thank God he’s alive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s a time stamp on it. One thirty-one AM. That was sent eight minutes ago.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: It’s a good thing, Ms. Leftcourt, it’s called a proof of life video. The kidnappers sent it to prove your son’s alive and that you do exactly what they ask.

utterance.speaker: MIRIELLE
utterance.content: Okay. You’ll do exactly what they ask you to, do you understand?

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: Wait. Play that last part again.

utterance.speaker: TYLER
utterance.content: Don’t forget to feed Ace.

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: Who’s Ace? I don’t know any Ace.

utterance.speaker: ELLIOT
utterance.content: We don’t have any pets.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s sending us a message.

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: He’s a smart boy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ace could refer to a person or a business.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, there’s another text. 680 Canal Streel. Thirty minutes.

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: That’s the building where I work.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s there? A jewelry store? A bank?

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: No, just offices.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why you? What’s so special that they need you?

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: Uh … oh God. Because I have elevator access to all the floors in the building.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re a human key.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, I just talked to the building’s owner. He’s emailing blueprints and a tenant list for 680 Canal, including the secure floors.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Ryan and Esposito are with me. We’ll take Dean to the building. I’ve arranged to have an ESU team standing by in striking distance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, you can’t take Dean to that building. It is way too dangerous.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s a father who loves his son. You’re not going to be able to stop him.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: And until we find the boy we don’t have any other choice. Scrub the video. Look for anything that could lead us to him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes sir.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay, we’re a block away.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’ll be able to see and hear everything that’s happening, okay? And we cloned your phone so we’ll be able to read your texts in real time.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: You follow the kidnapper’s instructions to the letter. No cowboy stuff, you understand me?

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: TYLER
utterance.content: Hi Dad. I know you’re worried, but I’m okay. They say if you do what they ask, everything will be fine, just don’t go to the police. I’ll see you soon, and don’t forget to feed Ace.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There are no identifying markers in the background. It’s all black. I don’t know if we’re going to find him in time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The video was taken at one thirty-one AM but they didn’t send it until one thirty-nine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, sometimes it takes a while for a text to go through.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but eight minutes? You want Dean to do something for you. You make a proof of life video. But you wait eight minutes to send it. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, maybe there wasn’t a signal, or not enough bars.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Maybe they had to walk a long way to get a signal. Maybe they were under a … Underground. Ace. It’s not Ace. It’s ACE. The A, C, and E subway lines.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They’re holding Tyler in the subway. He must have spotted a sign.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s half a dozen stations with an A, C, and E stop. That’s too many to search.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but the last stop for all three lines is on Canal Street and West Broadway. That’s –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right under Dean’s building. They’ve been holding him under everyone’s nose.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Check every room on the east end of the station. You guys check ticket booths on both ends. Go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, what are you thinking?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The only reason to keep him here is for a quick getaway, which is helped by the fact that 680 Canal Street has its own entrance to the subway. If it were me? I get close enough to hook up with my partners but far enough that I’d be out of the way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means he’s holding Tyler on the west end of the tunnel.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: West end of the tunnel … this room.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, you should stay back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not a chance.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Go to the thirty seventh floor now.

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: They said thirty minutes. It hasn’t been thirty minutes yet.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: They’re changing the time table. In case you went to the cops. What’s on the thirty seventh floor?

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: Nothing. It’s vacant. It’s not even secure.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Try Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s going straight to voicemail. She must already be in the subway.

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: I gotta go.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Remember, we can see and hear everything. Anything goes south and a hundred cops will be on you inside a minute.

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: Not until you find my son.

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: Just my luck. Pulled graveyard tonight.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: All right, he’s in.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not bad with the guard. Guy’s all right.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Camera and mic are all good.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oooh.

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: I want to see Tyler, first.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT KINCADE
utterance.content: Just follow instructions, you’ll see him soon enough.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: What’s on the thirty ninth floor?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: A financial firm, Breskin and Wright.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Thirty seven was just a staging area.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: They let him see their faces. As soon as they get what they came for, they’re going to kill him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Just like Lightbulb Len.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Beckett’s still going to voicemail. Castle too.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sir. What do you want to do?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: If we go in before we find the kid we might lose them both.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: One armed and the kid. If I go in he’ll kill him before I get a shot off.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s holding a flashlight. If we kill the ambient light he’ll light up like a Christmas tree. We just –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s like it’s meant to be.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe Lenny can prevent another tragedy. On my count.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Three, two, one.

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: I did what you asked. Now where’s Tyler?

utterance.speaker: ROBERT
utterance.content: You’ll see him in a minute.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT
utterance.content: We’re supposed to go to subway level. Why’re we stopping at the lobby?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: No, look at me.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: I suggest you drop your weapons.

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: Where’s Tyler?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The ringleader was Robert Kincade, former bond trader. He’s the one who planned the entire operation. The economy might have collapsed but he was still going to get his payday. Most of them were ex-Wall Street-ers. They knew that they needed biometric clearance in order to get on secure floors and they knew that Dean wasn’t going to help them, so they took Tyler as leverage.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But all they took were files.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Financial files. Containing unpublished earnings reports. To a savvy investor they’d be worth millions.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Would have worked, too, if Lightbulb Len hadn’t been taking pictures in the park. He helped catch his own killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And foiled a kidnapping. Kind of poetic.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In an unspeakably tragic sort of way.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: The guy you shot in the subway, the thug Kincade hired to do his dirty work, he just confessed to kidnapping Tyler, murdering Lightbulb Len, and no surprise, he ratted out Kincade in two seconds flat.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Speaking of rats. I gotta … I gotta go.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’m the worst person in the whole world.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, you’re not. You’re wonderful and kind and you’re sweet.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’m a rat killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You don’t know that. You may just be a loser.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A rat loser. This did not come out right. Look, he cares. He’ll understand.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: He’ll understand, all right. When he sees me in the halls at school he’ll think ‘there’s the awful girl that lost my best friend’.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s him.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ASHELY
utterance.content: Hi. I missed you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I missed you, too.

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: What … what’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s about Theodore. When fed him he must have got out of his cage and … and he’s gone.

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: He’s gone?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: We looked everywhere, I swear. We turned this whole place upside down.

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: How’d he get out?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I must not have locked the cage right. Ashley, I’m so sorry. You have every right to hate me.

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: C’mon, Alexis, I – I’m upset, but I don’t hate you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You don’t?

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: I mean, n– look at this place. Look at what you did to try to get him back. Who else would do that?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You cared about him a lot.

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: Yeah, but… I care about you more.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Found him.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
